item.title: [DELTA][317] Wilderness On and Off. [317][DELTA]
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

What’s the boolean used to tell if the player is in the wild? Find all the places that uses that boolean and just add another boolean checking if it’s true/false whichever you want.

Like…
This isn’t exact code to your server.

if(OtherPlayerIsInWild()//checking if the other player is in the wild.. 
 && this.InWild() {
if(this.WildOn) {
sM("You're both in wild, so you attack the player.");
} else {
sM("The wild was disabled by the owner.");
}
}

Read full topic

item.title: [DELTA][317] Wilderness On and Off. [317][DELTA]
item.dc:creator: @New_Legacy New Legacy
item.description:
@New_Legacy wrote:

Hello Moparscape,

I’m trying to make a unique command for my server, to turn the wilderness on and to turn it off. I’m not sure how to do it, I’ve made the wilderness areas for when the wilderness is on but I don’t know how to make the actual command turn the wilderness on and off. I want the commands to be like this; I am not expecting to be spoon fed because I have an idea of coding. I just need a starting spot and help on how to make it work and function. You may change the coding as much as you want, make it smaller or something. I am needing this now, after I get this I will be able to make things disabled and enabled with ease.

If (command.startsWith("wildyoff") && playerRights >= 3) {

// Code
sM("The wilderness has be disabled.");
}

If (command.startsWith("wildyon") && playerRights >= 3) {

// Code
sM("The wilderness has been enabled.");
}

Note: After I get it working and get help from all of you I will make a tutorial and release it with credits to who ever helped.
Thanks,

New Legacy. =)

Read full topic
